definition: to insist on doing sth/must do it, despite everything
to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
to demand/to request/to coerce

sentences.english: If you will go to bed so late, no wonder you're tired.
sentences.chinese: 如你偏要這麼晚睡覺，自然就會感到疲倦。

sentences.english: However the sandstorm is showing the opposite picture, and nobody could stop it.
sentences.chinese: 但是沙塵暴偏要來作對，那是誰也攔不住的。

sentences.english: Self-cleaning work, he only thing we seek the presence of people do?
sentences.chinese: 自我清理的工作，他爲嘛偏要當着人做呢？

sentences.english: He was not supposed to go but he insisted on going.
He persists in reading in bed.
Just when I was busiest, he must come worrying.
sentences.chinese: 我正忙得不可開交，他偏要帶麻煩的事。

sentences.english: She wondered why we had picked on that small room to work in.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道爲什麼我們偏要揀中那個小房間作爲工作室。

sentences.english: Regardless of warnings he would play with fire.
However, it is unfair, why did I experience this for nothing?
sentences.chinese: 但不公平的，爲什麼偏要白白走這一遭呢？

sentences.english: Everybody else accepts the decision. Why must you be so bloody-minded?
sentences.chinese: 別人都同意這個決議，你爲甚麼偏要故意刁難？

sentences.english: If you must go, at least wait until the storm is over.
sentences.chinese: 如果你偏要走，你至少要等到暴風雨停止。

sentences.english: Why go to South Africa, of all countries?
sentences.chinese: 國家多得很，爲什麼偏要到南非去？

sentences.english: Why go to Norway, of all countries?
sentences.chinese: 有的是國家，爲什麼偏要去挪威呢？

definition: to want absolutely/to insist on (doing something)
firmly set on doing sth/to insist on doing/determined in one's course of action

(indicates that sth turns out just the opposite of what one would wish) unfortunately/as it happened/(indicates that sth is the opposite of what would be normal or reasonable) stubbornly/contrarily/against reason/(indicates that sb or a group is singled out) precisely/only/of all people
(followed by a verb phrase, then – optionally – 不可, or 不行 etc) must
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
why bother?/is it worth the trouble?
to bring trouble on oneself
there is no need/why should
intentional/deliberate/on purpose
always
to pester someone again and again
(spoken) why?/for which reason?
see 幹嘛|干嘛[gan4 ma2]
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
perfectly all right/without rhyme or reason
